CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard Sovchen, student, Ross Township and Mr. Audie George, deckhand, Coal Center, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 7, 1962, pg. 12 with question: "How do you think the Pirates will do in 1962?" Mr. Richard Sovchen's answer reads: "I hope they will win the pennant, but I don't think they'll do it.  Anyway, they will probably make the first division."  Mr. Audie George's answer reads: "They'll probably do pretty good.  They won't make the top, but they might come pretty close to it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Richard Sovchen wearing dark sweater and coat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Audie George wearing light colored t-shirt and jacket with dark knitted sleeves and collar, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
